name: Man City Multiple Choice Quiz | Geography | 10 Questions

questions.text: Manila is the largest city of which nation?
questions.explanation:
The Philippines.

	One of the most densely populated cities in the world, Manila is the capital of The Philippines. The Pasig River flows through the city and is an important waterway of the country. This is a beautiful city with lots to see and do during a visit.

questions.text: Which country is home to Mannheim?
questions.explanation:
Germany.

	Mannheim is a city in Germany and is located at the confluence of the Rhine and the Neckar rivers. It is known as "The city of squares" because it is set up in a grid pattern. It is one of the largest cities in Germany.

questions.text: Managua is the capital and largest city in which country?
questions.explanation:
Nicaragua.

	Managua is capital and the biggest city in Nicaragua. There are at least four different lagoons in the city. This is a modern city with an airport, monorails, trains and museums.

questions.text: Manama is the largest city in which country?
questions.explanation:
Bahrain.

	Manama is the capital and largest city in the island nation of Bahrain. Located in the Persian Gulf this city is one of greenest areas in this desert nation. The city has ancient ruins, old mosques, and many restaurants to cater to tourists.

questions.text: Manavgat is a Turkish city famous for what?
questions.explanation:
A waterfall.

	Manavgat is a Turkish town well-known for its waterfall, a low fall waterfall on the Manavgat River. Located near the Taurus Mountains, this city is laid out on the plains of Turkey.  A national park lies right outside the city.

questions.text: The Pennines are a mountain/hill range near which English city?
questions.explanation:
Manchester.

	The Pennines or  Pennine Chain are a set of mountains and hills located to the northeast of Manchester. This lovely city is home to Beetham Tower, Oxford Road and Albert Square.

questions.text: What Man City is bounded by the Hudson, East, and Harlem rivers?
questions.explanation:
Manhattan.

	Manhattan is a densely populated city that is part of New York City. It served as the country's capital city from 1785 until 1790. Although Manhattan is the smallest borough in terms of land area, it the third-largest population of New York City's five boroughs.

questions.text: Manta has existed since Pre-Columbian times in which country?
questions.explanation:
Ecuador.

	Manta is a small city on the Pacific coat of Ecuador. The city is home to a large film festival. It also has a large airport and many beaches.

questions.text: To which country will I have to travel to go to Mandalay?
questions.explanation:
Myanmar.

	Located in the center of Myanmar, Mandalay is found on the banks of the Irrawaddy River. This city has lots of old ruins and temples for travelers to visit. This city was founded in 1857.

questions.text: Manitoba is a city in Canada.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Manitoba is a province in Canada, not a city. It is located in the center of the country. The capital of this province is Winnipeg. Lake Winnipeg is the tenth-largest freshwater lake in the world.
